e4: To mitigate legal liability, maintain long-term investor and regulatory trust, and achieve consistent ethical performance while prioritizing transparency in financial reporting, I recommend the adoption of the new policy eliminating bias. Retail investors benefit from fairer market practices, where all information used to price shares is honest. A communication strategy must effectively articulate the change to investors and minimize potential volatility. Education and protection measures for retail investors can further provide trust, transparency, and safeguard their interest.
e5: An ethical reporting policy values accuracy, transparency-to protect all investors and establish credibility -- and fairness, especially among novice and sophisticated investors alike. Considerately balancing stakeholder interests is crucial; addressing legal concerns while ensuring informed and timely disclosures. The new unbiased reporting helps promote market efficiency for both retail and sophisticated investors, eliminating an information-based inefficiency from the practice of consistent earnings manipulation.
e6: As a follow-up, consider discussing ways to create balanced communication strategies for multiple types of stakeholders - institutional and retail investors. Examine investor education possibilities and protection mechanisms in addressing potential market disparities if earnings biases were to subside. Finally, examine internal control policies which would deter further reported bias from emerging.
